column4: can someone PLEASE help me....I've followed every direction online. How can I mount a windows share in fstab (cifs) so that a non-root user can have full RW access to the dir and files?
is it ntfs ot fat32
ntfs, but that shouldn't make a difference, should it?
actually it does
ok, then please help me figure this out
hold on
start nautilus in sudo mode
ok
nautilus in sudo allows full rw
go to etc directory in the root
dont jump, in the etc directory there is a file fstab
gottit open
now mount your ntfs drive like this /dev/sda9                                  /media/Download  ntfs-3g  defaults,locale=en_IN          0  0
the mount is on a remote server on the LAN, not a local partition
youch why didn't you say so earlier? now this is hard

this is what I have: //192.168.1.254/usersdata/rachel /media/P cifs auto,user,isocharset=utf8,credentials=/home/rachel/.smbcredentials,rw,file_mode=0777,dir_mode=0777,nounix,uid=1001,gid=1001 0 0
